revised_title: Forced Ventilation in Animal Fur: Predicting Pressure Distribution and Intra-Fur Flow
tldr: The authors developed a model and computation scheme to predict forced ventilation in animal fur, using a fur-covered cylinder as a geometric model. They used an anisotropic model for intra-fur flow and pressure distribution data from a solid cylinder to obtain more realistic velocity profiles within the fur. The results can be used to develop a comprehensive model of transport processes in animal or artificial fur and other porous media under various environmental conditions.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Fluid Dynamics
